column5: Went out locally this morning for a couple of hours of bottom bouncing before work. Managed 2 steelhead and 2 browns, one of which was an absolute slab of a male brown in the 15lb range. Landed the beast and another angler took a photo which mysteriously didn't appear on my camera  . I'm guessing he inadvertantly turned the camera off  .  Also missed a nice shot of a 7lb bow when it slipped out of my hands and back in the water..  I did get shots of the other two       Not bad for a morning of hacking around!
I spent many a morning on that municiple dock during the fall when I lived in St.Kitts  Good job Mike!
Right on!!  Too bad about the butter fingers..  cheers HD

Nice work Solo   Must of been Romeo,he's known for that lol  Finally i know the spot your in,lucky to get there on the weekday without the zoo around...  Did the big male have a black bottom on him like this guy? he was caught this weekend just to the right of you in the pic....    but then this one was just beautiful in color(same spot)    cheers Streamerguy
Awesome work, hope to be down this weekend leave a few
Yep, looked just like that one. Can't imagine what weekends are like...it was shoulder to shoulder down there today!
Very nice pics Mike I would love to see one in person they look so pretty
Those are beautiful fish, man. I think i am missing out on some major browns action

Didnt see anyone beside you in the first pic ...Come weekend you'll see 3 other's in that same pic!!  Weird seeing you without your Centerpin  .............and bottom bouncing??   lol  Anyhow great report Solo  Streamerguy

Sure it was 15 pounds...I believe you.  Sure the guy "took the picture"....I believe that too.  Sure that bow slipped out of your hand....I believe that as well.  But come on...those fish pics look photoshopped to me....  Nice going Mike...can't wait for you next report!
Lookin good Mike,  Ill be getting out for some bouncin/surf floatin this weekend. My ditches are gin.
